alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Franklin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 4:57PM EDT until July 02 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Franklin County in southeastern Indiana... Southern Fayette County in east central Indiana... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 456 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Greenfield to 10 miles south of Franklin, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Batesville, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Blooming Grove, Columbia, Metamora, Laurel, Andersonville, Huntersville, Hamburg, Alpine, Nulltown, Peppertown, Everton and Buena Vista. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 148. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
